hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout in Low-Liquidity Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During a STRESS or BEAR regime, when aggregate crypto market volume remains >20% below its 30-day average for 5 consecutive days AND BTC 10-day realized volatility compresses below 30%, the subsequent 2-day breakout direction (up or down) will have >65% predictive accuracy for the next 5-day trend.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volume + low volatility in a stressed regime creates a liquidity vacuum. The first significant move often attracts momentum and short-covering flows, creating a self-reinforcing trend as latent orders are triggered in a thin market.
entry_conditions: Aggregate crypto market volume < 0.8 * its 30-day SMA for 5 consecutive days
BTC price breaks above/below the 5-day high/low on increasing volume (trigger)

exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price reverses through the 5-day opening price after entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: Close position at EOD 5 days after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: The direction of the initial 2-day breakout fails to predict the 5-day trend direction more than 50% of the time.
